verses.roman:
śāstra-lokātīta yei yei bhāva haya
itara-lokera tāte nā haya niścaya

synonyms: śāstra-loka-atīta—beyond the conception of people and the revealed scriptures; yei yei—whatever; bhāva—emotional ecstasies; haya—there are; itara-lokera—of common men; tāte—in that; nā haya—there is not; niścaya—belief.
translation: These ecstasies are not described in the śāstras, and they are inconceivable to common men. Therefore people in general do not believe in them.
